column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 26 and have suffered with year-round allergies my entire life. I have taken many nasal sprays and switched to Flunisolide due to insurance coverage. This is the most painful nasal spray. I have never had a problem with Nasonex or Flonase, but this burns so bad I am not able to take my full dosage (two squirts per nostril, twice a day). I can only do one squirt/nostril because it burns. The taste is also so bad! There are much better products that are way more effective and without the pain!

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: Cindy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: for 40 years I have fought allergies.  This nasal spray helps with the inflamation and pain year round.  I do not like the weird taste I get, but it goes away quickly.  Am going to a specialist to discuss long term effects of this drug

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I find that most of this medication runs back out of the nose. It also burns when sprayed.

column2: Nancy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Strangely enough this medication started working imediately. Just one spray in each side before bed each night did the trick. I was able to breath through my nose all night and in the morning I didnt have a big build-up of snot to blow out. What a relief.

column1: Chronic Inflammation of the Nose Not due to Allergies
column2: USAFSGT, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have suffered with chronic, bilateral, maxillary, sinusitis with the accompanying severe congestion for over 30 years.I have had 3 sinus operations in the past. Have lived on some medication or another. While not a big fan of inhaled steroids I will confess that it works. It is better than the old inhaler filled with Beconase.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column9: I came from using Flonase which worked well. That only needs to be used once a day. 2-3 times is a hassle. Plus, I have had a cough ever since I started using it.

column2: acinamonqueen@hotmail.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: this works for me whne nothing else does and stops sinus headaches.

column2: biobirder, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication burned my sinuses upon inhaling, dranied a bad taste down my throat, and gave me nose bleeds.  Not worth the side effects.  I was using Rhinocort without any of these symptoms.

column9: After using this drug for several years I have developed an oral fungus
